intro: Chloranthus anhuiensis, commonly known as the Anhui chloranthus, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Chloranthaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as mountain forests. Its flowers are usually clustered in inflorescences and bloom in the spring. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a valuable species for botanical study and conservation efforts.
